full_text:
Here's a preview of blitz data for KC vs TB this week. Offense first. Note the difference in both blitzes faced and EPA/play on 3rd downs. KC kills it. TB dies. 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/9pbZGiuFSJ

Here's the defense. KC doesn't blitz all that often, while TB blitzes at an above average rate on all downs but 4th. Both teams blitzes are very effective. 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/PaR7Pmwowd

QB play to start the season has regressed from what we are accustomed to seeing. Baker, Kyler, Wilson and Cousins have experienced the largest drops in efficiency.

A few QBs to see an increase in production this year include; Hurts, Lawrence, Lamar, and Allen. 

#nflverse https://t.co/h6APvuRUEA

An overview of the personnel used and the relative proe.

Interesting to see the differences between teams like Rams, Commanders, Bengals, with a single personnel and Ravens, Falcons, Browns, with various. 

#nflverse https://t.co/ij0TrmI7Ag

Deleted the previous version, as I hadn't filtered to just dropbacks, so it was showing numbers for ALL snaps instead. Here's the corrected version. Offense first. Chiefs are still good vs blitz. Bucs are very not good vs the blitz. 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/gZ0FlmAEnx

Here's the defenses. KC is pretty good at blitzing. TB is above the NFL average in nearly every category here. They are superb at this. 

#nflverse #rstats #gtExtras https://t.co/04exyg0w0V
